channel.title: Binary Tree on
channel.description: Recent content in Binary Tree on

item.title: Binary Search Tree
item.description: Binary Search Trees(BST) are [[notes/Binary Tree]] that have a left subtree that only contains values smaller than the root node, the right subtree only contains values greater than the root node.

item.title: Binary Search Tree - In-Order Traversal
item.description: Inorder search for a [[notes/Binary Search Tree]] searches nodes from lowest to highest. As Binary search trees are ordered in a way that all nodes in the left subtree contain a lower value than the current node.

item.title: Binary Tree - Level Order Traversal
item.description: Level Order Traversal is essentially storing the nodes of each level/depth of the [[notes/Binary Tree]]. This can be performed iteratively using a Queue datastructure.
